contest-event.event-date: Oct. 7, 1978 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Four Dances from Checkmate Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Note: Prizes: First: 500 Second: 200 Third: 100 Fourth: 75 Three of the four movements of the test piece were used: Ceremony of the Red Bishops, Dance of the Four Knights and the Finale "Checkmate". Lady Bliss herself presented the prizes. The winning conductor received a presentation score of the test piece. Dalmellington Band from Scotland withdrew prior to the contest. May 26, 2010, 12:27 p.m. Jan. 26, 2013, 9:37 p.m. 1 Yorkshire Imperial Brass Band Denis Carr 2 Besses o' th' Barn Roy Newsome 3 Grimethorpe Colliery Band Stanley Boddington 4 Fairey Band Walter B. Hargreaves 5 Fodens Band James Scott 6 St. Dennis Band Eddie Williams 7 Cory Band Denzil Stephens 7 Hanwell Band Barbara Stone 9 Reg Vardy Band Geoffrey Brand 10 Woodfalls Band William Buchan 11 The GUS Band Geoffrey Brand 12 Carlton Main Frickley Colliery Band David James 12 City of Coventry Kenneth Dennison 14 Tredegar Town Band William David Thomas 14 Camborne Town Band Derek Greenwood 14 Newhall Band Ernest Woodhouse 17 Alder Valley Brass George Prior 18 Luton Band Lyn Morgan 19 Westoe Band Dennis Wilby 19 Newmains James Rennie Withdrawn Dalmellington Band Richard Evans
